image.altText: A young black man walks through the airport being ushered by a police officer in a white button up shirt

props.synopsis: Koang Wuordol was arrested in Melbourne on the weekend and extradited to Alice Springs, where he has been charged with the murder of 19-year-old Yiel Gatluak whose body was found on a dirt road on January 1.

title.children: Koang Wuordol, 22, appears in Alice Springs court charged with murder of Yiel Gatluak

image.altText: Donald Trump holding his hands aloft and smiling

props.synopsis: The Iowa caucuses were never a question of if Donald Trump could win, but of by how much. The first race of the 2024 election still held a few surprises. These are the key takeaways.

title.children: A Trump tsunami and a surprise in second place: What to know about the first key vote of 2024

image.altText: Trump, wearing a white campaign cap, poses with a stern face in front of a screen that reads Trump Country

props.synopsis: Would ordinary Americans really vote for the return of a politician currently facing 91 criminal charges? Thanks to Iowa, we have the answer from Republican voters and it is a resounding yes, writes Leigh Sales.

title.children: Why do Americans want to give Donald Trump another chance as president? His reality holds magical appeal

image.altText: A woman holds a bunch of pink flowers

props.synopsis: Darwin's once numerous flower farmers have shrunk from 40 in the 1980s to five, with those left inching closer to retirement.

title.children: It's a job with overseas travel and regular pay, so why are there so few cut flower growers in the Top End?

image.altText: Sarah Snook in a red dress with her arms out holding an Emmy.

props.synopsis: Australian actress Sarah Snook thanks her baby daughter, saying "it was her who carried me" as she wins the best drama actress award at the Emmys.

title.children: Sarah Snook wins Emmy, pays tribute to baby daughter — and Elton John achieves EGOT status

image.altText: A tennis ball hits the strings of Thanasi Kokkinakis's racket as he plays a slice backhand.

props.synopsis: Australia's world number 45, Max Purcell, drops six match points against Hungarian qualifier Mate Valkusz before finally moving through to the second round in the singles at his home slam for the first time. Follow live.

title.children: Thanasi Kokkinakis wins opening set in tie-break, Purcell scores first singles win at Australian Open

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Ofner breaks Kokkinakis twice to take second set 6-2
Live score: Thanasi Kokkinakis wins opening set tie-break
Live score: Aussie wildcard Kim Birrell faces 11th seed Jeļena Ostapenko

image.altText: Ash Barty looks focused during a match

props.synopsis: Ash Barty left many an opponent frustrated during her illustrious career, including the woman who replaced her at the top of the world rankings.

title.children: How Ash Barty 'annoyed' Iga Świątek into becoming world number one

image.altText: crowds at the tennis

props.synopsis: Players at Australia's grand slam are split on a new seating policy that lets fans into the stands twice as often during a match.

title.children: 'Wokest tournament ever': Australian Open seating policy ruffles players' feathers

image.altText: A man with a black and grey bear wearing a red shirt holds a round egg in his fingers.

props.synopsis: His hens have laid more than a million eggs over the past five years, but Fabian Fabbro on the New South Wales North Coast has never seen anything quite like this.

title.children: After collecting more than one million eggs from his hens, NSW farmer Fabian Fabbro makes a unique discovery

image.altText: Two young men in suits in a dark room.

props.synopsis: Ash Gordon beat the odds in his quest to dedicate his life to caring for others. On the weekend, the 33-year-old was fatally stabbed during a home invasion. His loved ones want the world to know how proud they were of the remarkable man.

title.children: ‘What's the world come to?': Family of slain Victorian GP calls for crackdown on crime

image.altText: A large, dark and ominous cloud hangs over the Darwin skyline

props.synopsis: There's monsoonal rain in the Top End while severe thunderstorms are forecast for the south-east. Here is a snapshot of the weather across Australia.

title.children: Monsoonal rain, flood warnings and severe thunderstorms. Here's a look at the weather across the country

image.altText: Kris Werner's fair middle-aged hand fingers a dried apricot on a wooden pallet drying rack in the sun.

props.synopsis: Lovers of dried fruit could face shortages of some Australian-grown products this year as unfavourable weather conditions create a global decline in production.

title.children: Wet summer threatens to create a shortage of Australian-grown dried fruit

image.altText: Purple ute travelling on major Tasmanian highway as seen by a dash cam in pursuing car.

props.synopsis: Two women are charged after a Hobart Hurricanes ute was captured on video travelling down a highway with a person in back holding down a box — but the cricket club won't say if the pair are players.

title.children: Women charged after illegal act in back of cricket club ute on highway

image.altText: A man wearing sunglasses

props.synopsis: A 33-year-old man will spend the next three days in jail after refusing to give evidence during a committal hearing into an alleged murder in southern Queensland.

title.children: Witness in alleged hit-and-run murder jailed for refusing to testify

image.altText: An Extinction Rebellion protester hangs from a bridge.

props.synopsis: Meme Caroline Thorne, whose peak-hour protest outside the Adelaide Convention Centre during an oil and gas conference triggered the SA government to introduce new anti-obstruction laws, is ordered to pay $750 in compensation to the emergency services who retrieved her.

title.children: Extinction Rebellion bridge abseiler who halted Adelaide traffic sentenced over protest

image.altText: Police helicopter in hangar

props.synopsis: In response to a recent crime wave in Townsville, the Queensland government has ordered a dedicated police chopper and digitally encrypted radios meant to stop criminals intercepting communications.

title.children: New police chopper and $13 million encrypted radio system to fight crime in north Queensland

image.altText: A woman crying and being comforted

props.synopsis: Dallas Hayden — the wife of former governor-general and one-time Labor Party leader Bill Hayden — has died, after her husband's passing last October.

title.children: Dallas Hayden dies less than three months after her husband, former governor-general Bill Hayden

image.altText: Stephen Edwards with parents David and Nelda

props.synopsis: Brothers Stephen and Robert Edwards have given evidence in the inquest into their parents' 2016 deaths. The brothers had previously been charged in relation to their mother's death, but the charges were later dropped.

title.children: Elderly woman was not in imminent danger of death when given palliative care drugs, inquest hears

image.altText: A shirtless man holds a cigarette

props.synopsis: An Australian man accused of multiple counts of child sexual abuse is the subject of an arrest warrant in Timor-Leste, after failing to show up to court last month.

title.children: Australian man facing child sex abuse charges in Timor-Leste

image.altText: Three women in dresses on the red carpet

props.synopsis: The 2023 Emmys might be happening four months after their originally scheduled date but the red carpet looks are still fresh.

title.children: Emmys red carpet: Glittering greens and fiery reds dominate the night's fashion

image.altText: Two images side by side of an older man with a long ponytail and a teenage boy in a school uniform

props.synopsis: One of two men accused of murdering Steven Murphy, whose remains were found in an underground bunker in Adelaide's north, instead pleads guilty to assisting his father in the crime.

title.children: Murder charge dropped as Marco Yandle instead pleads guilty to assisting his father

image.altText: Donald Trump smiles on stage next to a sign saying TRUMP WINS IOWA

props.synopsis: Donald Trump thanks the "great people of Iowa" after decisively winning the state's Republican caucuses, setting him up with a strong lead to be the party's nominee for the 2024 presidential election. Look back over how the day's events unfolded.

title.children: Iowa Republicans pick Trump as presidential nominee in first caucuses of 2024

image.altText: Naomi Osaka reflects during her first-round match at the Australian Open.

props.synopsis: Playing the Australian Open just six months after giving birth to a baby girl, Naomi Osaka admits she has to set realistic goals as she continues her return to the WTA Tour.

title.children: 'Delusional': Former champ Osaka gives blunt assessment of comeback following Australian Open exit

image.altText: Nine flags wave in the wind on top of a fence with a snow covered mountain in the background.

props.synopsis:
The survey conducted by PwC revealed executives believe there needs to be a major overhaul if their companies want to stay afloat with setbacks like artificial intelligence and climate change.

CEOS around the world fear their companies won't survive another decade, survey shows

title.children: CEOs fear climate change and AI threats could doom their companies in 10 years, survey shows

image.altText: An artist impression of a newly designed convention centre on the Perth boardwalk

props.synopsis: Plans are unveiled for a major redevelopment of Perth’s Convention Centre, a building that has long been criticised for being ugly and not taking advantage of its prime riverside location.

title.children: WA Premier says redevelopment of Perth convention centre would 'right an historic wrong'

image.altText: The torso and arms of a boy infected with measles showing a rash on his skin.

props.synopsis: NSW Health says there have been "significant outbreaks" overseas, and is urging travellers to check their vaccination status.

title.children: Measles alert issued in Western Sydney after baby tests positive to the highly contagious disease

image.altText: A man rides a bike with cattle behind him

props.synopsis: A 22-year-old woman has been charged with an attack that has left 23-year-old Jake Loader in an induced coma with life-threatening injuries.

title.children: Woman charged over burning, maiming man with corrosive fluids in southern NSW

image.altText: A Beriev A-50 military airplane flies upward against a blue sky

props.synopsis: If confirmed, the destruction of the Beriev A-50 and an Il-22 will be a landmark feat for Ukraine in the almost two-year war.

title.children: Ukraine says it shot down Russian surveillance plane over Azov Sea
